answers.answer: Are you positively certain your medical doctor instructed you to NOT take your insulin? Speaking personally, I have my doubts about a doctor who said to try a health changing diet "at my own risk". Is she your PCP? If so, you need to get a second opinion preferably from a diabetes specialist, an Endocrinologist.You feel fine because your body has gotten accustomed to your very high & unhealthy glucose levels. Let us know what she has to say about your fax. BTW, what were those 5 day levels?

question: this is my 7th day on sublingual HCG drops and my sugars today fasting are 335, my dr advised me to  do this diet at my own risk and not to take my insulin, however keep a very close eye on my sugar levels, This morning I faxed her my last 5 days of sugar counts but i am worried. I feel fine, just worried.
title: HCG and diabetic
